title: Ana de Armas looks every inch the Bond Girl as bikini-clad star emerges from sea in sizzling snap
text:
She's set to make her debut as Bond Girl Paloma in upcoming 007 film No Time to Die, where she will portray Daniel Craig's new love interest.

And Ana de Armas appeared to emulate her predecessors - including Die Another Day star Halle Berry and Dr. No's Ursula Andress - as she emerged from the sea in a radiant snap posted to her Instagram account on Sunday.

The War Dogs actress, 31, sent temperatures soaring in a navy paisley print bikini as she treated herself to a well-deserved holiday with her gal pal before resuming filming for the spy movie.

Working it: Bond Girl Ana de Armas (L) appeared to emulate her predecessors - including Die Another Day star Halle Berry (pictured R in the film) as she emerged from the sea on holiday

Displaying her enviably toned physique, the screen star looked typically sensational in her classic triangle bikini top and matching briefs.

With her tresses styled into beachy waves, the Cuban bombshell proved less is certainly more as she opted for a glowing, make-up free appearance.

Ana appeared to pay homage to actress Ursula - who played Honey Ryder in the 1962 film edition of the franchise - and Halle's Jinx - who became the first African-American Bond Girl in 2002.

Striking: In a radiant snap posted to her Instagram account on Sunday, the War Dogs actress, 31, The War Dogs actress, 31, sent temperatures soaring in a navy paisley print bikini

Inspiration: The Cuban bombshell appeared to pay homage to actress Ursula Andress, 83 - who played Honey Ryder in the 1962 film edition of the franchise (pictured in Dr. No)

Well-deserved: The Hands of Stone star treated herself to a beachy getaway with her gal pal before resuming filming for the spy movie

Glowing: With her tresses styled into beachy waves, the TV star proved less is certainly more as she opted for a make-up free appearance

In April, Ana was confirmed as one of the cast members of the 25th installment in the Bond franchise.

The film star will be one of the franchise's iconic Bond Girls, following in the footsteps of actresses including Eva Green and Rosamund Pike.

Production for the hotly-anticipated movie is currently underway with Daniel Craig recently spotted filming scenes in Italy.

Ana made the successful crossover to Hollywood in 2015 alongside Keanu in Knock Knock and then went on to work with Ryan Gosling and Robin Wright in 2017's Blade Runner 2049.

The actress' role as a Bond Girl proves to be a complete change of luck for her, as she previously told Harper's Bazaar that Hollywood roles were difficult to come by.

'These roles are definitely rare. That's my fight and I always try to go for them when they come up. As a woman and a Latina, it's pretty challenging,' she previously said.

'I have two separate labels to fight against, but I know I just have to stay strong and true to what I believe in'.
